name: Read and Reflect
description: Choose a Category to Start Your R&R

backbone.name: Backbone
backbone.description: These blog posts will help you get up and running with Backbone.

getting-started.name: Getting Started
getting-started.description: The "Getting Started" section of the Backbone documentation gives a good overview of the different parts of Backbone.
getting-started.instructions: You only need to read the "Getting Started" section. You can stop once you get to Events. (If you want to skim through the F.A.Q, it has some interesting stuff, but don't worry if you don't understand everything right away.)

building-a-simple-backbone-app.name: Building a Simple Backbone App
building-a-simple-backbone-app.description: Explore the pieces of a simple app built with Backbone
building-a-simple-backbone-app.instructions: Try and get this code working on your local machine. If possible, pretend you're building it from the ground up. Add each piece of functionality, and get it working before you add the next.

hello-backbone.name: Hello Backbone
hello-backbone.description: These five heavily commented code examples help you go from building simple apps to more complex ones.
hello-backbone.instructions: Get all of these code examples working on your computer. Don't only follow what the examples do. Take time to explore, and add your own features. Make the apps work how you want them to work.

addy-backbone-basics.name: Diving Deeper with Backbone
addy-backbone-basics.description: Addy Osmani's book is one of the best Backbone resources on the web. He'll help us explore Backbone's features and intricacies at a deeper level.
addy-backbone-basics.instructions: This is an incredible book, but it's also very detailed. This can be overwhelming. Read the entire Backbone Basics section until you get to the Summary (there's a Table of Contents at the top if it helps). You're not expected to memorize everything -- rather, you should notice all the things that Backbone can do, and come back to this resource later as a reference.

addy-todo-app.name: Building a Todo Application from Scratch
addy-todo-app.description: We explore how to build a app of a bit more complexity... and if you took JavaScript Design Patterns, it's an app you might recognize!
addy-todo-app.instructions: Build the app along with the book, but try to avoid blindly copying and pasting. Remember that every line of code does something, so make sure you try and figure out what that is before you type it in.

addy-library-app.name: Building a Book Library App from Scratch
addy-library-app.description: This is the second example app of Addy Osmani's Backbone book. In this section, you'll build a non Todo sample application.
addy-library-app.instructions: Build the app along with the book, but try to avoid blindly copying and pasting. This tutorial also walks us through creating a back-end for our application. Although you can choose to skip this section, it's incredibly empowering to build a full app, back-end and all. Give it a try.

annotated-source-code.name: Backbone.js Annotated Source Code
annotated-source-code.description: This optional reading walks through the source code for Backbone itself!
annotated-source-code.instructions: This is a great resource for learning how Backbone actually works. Remember that even organizational libraries and frameworks are written in plain and understandable JavaScript.

android.name: Android
android.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Eaque praesentium, temporibus officia sapiente totam, in molestiae, fugit corrupti suscipit aut architecto beatae vel et. Sed sint debitis voluptatibus error odit.

user-input-controls.name: User Input Controls
user-input-controls.description: User Interface Controls is just a fancy phrase for things in Android that you can see and interact with. Here you will find resources on how to use things like toggle buttons, radio buttons, spinners( drop downs) and more.

toggle-button.name: How do you use a toggle button in Android?
toggle-button.description: Follow the instructions in this blog to learn how to use a toggle button by creating a new android app from scratch

edit-text.name: Best ways of using an Edit Text in your app
edit-text.description: Read this blog and learn how you can use EditText inside your own apps.

autocomplete.name: How does one use Autocomplete in a mobile app?
autocomplete.description: In this blog you will find instructions on how autocomplete works in the Android ecosystem. Create a new app and practice how to incorporate Autocomplete within it.

mvc-in-android.name: Is there an MVC pattern in Android?
mvc-in-android.description: Read this Stackoverflow entry to learn more about how MVC is accomplished in Android.
